# Welcome!

## Overview of workshop {.bigger}

::: {style="font-size: 130%;"}
The __Bayesian Modeling for Environmental Health Workshop__ is a one-day intensive course of seminars and hands-on analytical sessions to provide an _approachable_ and _practical_ overview of __concepts__, __techniques__, and __data analysis methods__ used in Bayesian modeling with applications in Environmental Health.
:::

## Overview of workshop {.smaller}

::: incremental
- By the end of the workshop, participants should be familiar with the following topics:

  - Principles of Bayesian inference
  - Practicalities of Bayesian inference
  - Choosing priors
  - Different data structures (spatial, point, continuous, categorical)
  - Advantages and drawbacks of Bayesian approaches
  - Temporal modeling
  - Spatial modeling
  - Spatio-temporal modeling
  - Examples of use
  - Examples of current and future research
:::
